entry.title: Combined summary - Testnet block generation
entry.summary: A user on the Bitcoin network has raised a query regarding the fast generation of blocks in the testnet3. The network generates at least 6 blocks per minute and the user seeks clarification on whether this is normal behavior. It is unclear what specific issue the user is facing.Mattia Rossi, a member of the bitcoin-dev mailing list, posed the question about the fast block generation and whether it was normal. Jameson Lopp, a bitcoin developer, explained that this is due to a special rule on the testnet. To gain more insight into this special rule, Jameson provided a link to a blog post from Blocktrail that explains how 16k blocks were found in one day during testing. The explanation for the fast block generation can be found in the provided link.
